name: node-in-docker-as-user
description: Example `Dockerfile` where I use a non-root user for the executing the command.

scripts.docker-build: NAME=$(node -p 'require("./package.json").name'); VERSION=$(node -p 'require("./package.json").version')-$(git rev-parse --short HEAD); docker kill $NAME-build 2>/dev/null || true; docker rm $NAME-build 2>/dev/null || true; mkdir -p target && rm -f target/slug.tgz; docker build -t $NAME-build --file=docker/build/Dockerfile . && docker run --name $NAME-build $NAME-build && docker cp $NAME-build:/home/app/build/target/slug.tgz target && docker build -t $NAME:$VERSION --file docker/run/Dockerfile .
scripts.docker-run: echo Port is ${PORT:=3000}; NAME=$(node -p 'require("./package.json").name'); VERSION=$(node -p 'require("./package.json").version')-$(git rev-parse --short HEAD); docker kill $NAME 2>/dev/null || true; docker rm $NAME 2>/dev/null || true; docker run -t -p $PORT:$PORT --env PORT=$PORT --name $NAME $NAME:$VERSION
scripts.slug: npm run clean && npm run dist && (cd target/dist && tar czf ../slug.tgz *)
scripts.dist: mkdir -p target/dist && cp -r lib *.js package.json target/dist && (cd target/dist && rm -rf node_modules && cp -r ../../node_modules . && npm install --production && npm prune --production)

author: Hugo Josefson <hugo@josefson.org>
